@DarkosxX That's true I guess, but don't you think it'd be highly unlikely to find brothers that different from the same parents? I looked up "biological brothers who have different skin tones."  While they might be different in some aspects, they literally have to similar in some as well. That's how genes work. They cannot be completely different in every way, or the world just hasn't seen one yet. I'm not dissing you, but from what I've learned about genetics and Punnett squares makes this impossible. There are dominant traits that have to be passed onto both. They literally have to be similar in some way, shape, or form. At least we can agree that the story was trash
